html: Deliverance and destruction characterize the time of Jehovah’s coming to reign on the earth. Destruction overtakes “enemies” and “adversaries” (v 18 )—whether those of his own people (Isaiah 1:24; 26:11 ) or the nations (Isaiah 41:11; 42:13 )—all who violate the rights of his elect. Upon them Jehovah sends a hostile “torrent” or “river” (nahar )—the king of Assyria/Babylon at the height of his power (Isaiah 7:20; 8:7 ). Redemption comes to the Zion/Jerusalem category of Jehovah’s people and levels higher, including persons in the Jacob/Israel category who repent of transgression (cf. Isaiah 1:27 ).
